title: riot, I don't want to join a team to climb to high elo
body: It sounds fun on paper - joining a team and climbing the ladder together as friends, and it probably would be if I had the time and friends to do so. In reality, everyone has shit to do and it is hard to coordinate 5+ people to play and practice together. Climbing to high elo should not be gated by how many friends I have or my ability to keep a consistent schedule. It makes absolutely no sense that riot would initially be opposed to sand box mode because it "increases the barrier to entry", only to make playing solo a massive disadvantage for climbing. Some of the friends I had that got into WoW revolved their entire lives around their raid schedule. Is this what riot really wants high elo to become? "Sorry I can't go out tonight, my LoL team has practice." I'm sure some people are into that kind of gaming lifestyle, but for a more casual MOBA it really makes no sense.

I don't even look if there is a premade or not in the game because they simply don't matter. If I play properly, I'll win more than I'll lose in the long run.

the actual issue is not that people cant climb, if people suck they suck the system wont affect it. the problem is the individual ranks means less due to dynamic boosting. say U are plat 3 only playing solo, and there is that plat 3 only playing with premades, the value of that plat 3 who play with premade is definitely much lower than the plat 3 only playing solo. and when the number of premade plat 3 started growing rapidly plat3 as a division on it's own becomes less meaningful.

Why is the value lower? Just because one person climbs to plat by himself does not mean he is any better or worse than someone who climbs there in a group.  If 5 people that were gold last season group together and learn to play the game better and make there way to plat they most certainly deserve it. I love the flip flop arguments that this has started on the boards. People keep talking about how easy it is to boost someone now because all you need is a couple of high elo friends and bam you are instantly in a higher elo than you deserve. But then everyone says that there is not enough high elo players to make groups possible and it screws up matchmaking. Which is it not enough high elo people or everyone knows 3-4 high elo players. Then you get people saying the majority of people hate the Dynamic que system and they are all going to quit paying money untill riot changes back. But people keep saying riot only made these changes to make money off all the people that like to play together. But if the majority of people hate it who is going to make them all this money.

It's not just about boosting with the system.

The problem is playing as a team gives you more advantages than playing solo. If you are say in silver, and you team up with some other silver friends, as long as you guys have voice chat there is a high chance that you can climb. because most of the premades right now are just people teaming with random people they knew online, not real life friends, the synergy and communication is much less than a real life premade.

With taht being said, say you are silver 5 and you climbed to gold 3 with your team, and now you play solo and queue with random people. there is a VERY HIGH possibility of you not being as good as normal gold 3s when playing in solo, because you rely on playing as a team and you climbed with team synergy not individual skill. Your mechanic will be outclassed and you will lose when you queue up solo.

Or you continue playing as a team, then eventually your team will stop because your entire team is outclassed, to the point that even team synergy can not help you win the game anymore, because every single lane got stomp so hard. 

**TL;DR 
**
It is much more likely for players to focus on themselves and improve their individual skills when playing in solo queue. Even if dynamic queue player aren't asking for higher elo to boost them, they will still improve less because their focus is on the team play not the individual skill.

Is it?  I mean, the Plat 3 playing Pre Made has shown the ability to work in a group dynamic, to execute strategy, to communicate, and some base line ability at the very least to be mechanically sound.

He brings value to any Team he is on due to this.

While the Solo Plat 3 may well be more Mechanically Sound and have a more Carry Mentality.

So each would/could be stronger than the other in certain areas.

If, for example, you happened to need that Hard Carry Mentality, the Solo Plat 3 would be better for your Team.  If you needed that more Utility Focused, System Mentality then the Pre Made Plat 3 would be the better option.
